newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Comerci launches credit program.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Comerci launches credit program.

text.p: Mexican retailer Comercial Mexicana SA (Comerci) has launched a new credit program for customers in association with Banco Bital, the company said on Wednesday.

The retailer, Mexico's second largest, will offer clients a credit card called Credicomer that allows them to buy white goods and other big-ticket items with only 15 percent down-payment, a company official told Reuters.
Customers could repay through a series of either weekly or monthly payments at low interest.
The scheme is similar to one used by competitor Elektra, analysts said.
Analysts added that the credit risk would be taken on by Bital.
"Comerci has agreed to a deal with Bital bank to offer credits similar to Elektra...and Bital takes on 100 percent of the financing risk," said Rolando Calderon, an analyst at Santander Investment.
Calderon said the move would likely be good for both sides and boost Comerci's sales slightly in higher-margin products.
